```{r libraries, warnings = F}
library(tidyverse)
library(leaflet)
library(leaflegend)
library(readxl)
library(crosstalk)
library(sf)
library(htmltools)

```

```{r, results='hide'}
# import data

sxfer <- read_csv("clean_data/sxfer.csv") |> 
  filter(yr == 2023)

# school corporation boundaries
in_dis <-
  st_read("clean_data/corp_geo.geojson",
          layer = "corp_geo.geojson")


cp <- read_xlsx("raw_data/fall-2022-2023-public-corporation-transfer-report-v2.xlsx",
                sheet = 3,
                skip = 1) 

# new column names  
nc <- 
  c(
    "stlmt_corp_id",
    "stlmt_corp_name",
    "leg_stl_tot",
    "res_nrl_tot",
    "pub_incoming",
    "pub_outgoing",
    "net_pub",
    "non_pub_outgoing",
    "net_xfr"
  )

colnames(cp) <- nc

cp <- cp |> 
  mutate(xfr_rate = round((net_xfr/leg_stl_tot)*100)) 

# update column names
nc <- colnames(cp) 

# update cp with corrected school corporation names (done already in sxfer)
cp <- 
  left_join(
    
    sxfer |> select(stlmt_corp_id, stlmt_corp_name) |> 
      # need to remove West Clark Community Schools - present in sxfer dataframe but was replaced by Borden Henryville in Jul 2020
      filter(stlmt_corp_id != "0940") |> 
      distinct(),
    
    cp, 
    
    by = 'stlmt_corp_id') |> 
  
  # remove extra stlmt_corp_name column  
  select(-stlmt_corp_name.y)

# update column names 
colnames(cp) <- nc

# join with geometry for school corporation boundaries
cp <- 
  left_join(
    cp,
    in_dis, 
    join_by('stlmt_corp_id'== 'corp_id')
  ) |> 
  
  # add label column that details the net transfer rate per 100 students with legal settlement
  mutate(lab = HTML(paste0("<strong>",stlmt_corp_name, "<br> Net transfer rate:</strong>", xfr_rate)),
         xfr_rate_2 = if_else(xfr_rate > 100, 100, xfr_rate)
  ) |> 
  # remove unneeded columns
  select(-c(STATEFP, UNSDLEA, AFFGEOID, GEOID, STUSPS, STATE_NAME, LSAD, ALAND, AWATER))


# convert to sf dataframe
cp <- st_as_sf(cp) |> 
  group_by(corp_name) |>
  
  # remove duplicate rows
  distinct(stlmt_corp_id, .keep_all = T) |> 
  # add caption for over label that details net transfer rate from school of legal settlement for net transfers map layer
  mutate(
    lab2 =
      case_when(
        # if rate is more than 1 student
        xfr_rate >= 2 ~ HTML(paste0("<span style = 'font-weight:bold'> ", stlmt_corp_name, "</span> gained <br>", format(abs(xfr_rate), big.mark = ","), " students for every 100 within its boundaries in 2023.")),
        # if rate is 0
        xfr_rate == 0 ~ HTML(paste0("<span style = 'font-weight:bold'> ", stlmt_corp_name,
                                    if_else(
                                      str_sub(stlmt_corp_name, nchar(stlmt_corp_name)) == "s", "'", "'s"), "</span> <br>incoming and outgoing transfers were equal in 2023.")),
        # if rate is less than or equal to 2 students
        xfr_rate <= -2 ~ HTML(paste0("<span style = 'font-weight:bold'> ", stlmt_corp_name, "</span> lost <br>", format(abs(xfr_rate), big.mark = ","), " students for every 100 within its boundaries in 2023.")),
        # if rate is - 1
        xfr_rate == -1 ~ HTML(paste0("<span style = 'font-weight:bold'> ", stlmt_corp_name, "</span> lost <br>", format(abs(xfr_rate), big.mark = ","), " student for every 100 within its boundaries in 2023.")),
        # if rate is + one student
        xfr_rate == 1 ~ HTML(paste0("<span style = 'font-weight:bold'> ", stlmt_corp_name, "</span> gained <br>", format(abs(xfr_rate), big.mark = ","), " student for every 100 within its boundaries in 2023.")
        )
      ))


```

```{r, legend}
# set diverging color palette for choropleth map with red for negative transfer rates and blue for positive transfer rates 
# ht stackoverflow.com/questions/60321495/merging-palettes-with-colorramppalette-and-plotting-with-leaflet

# set negative palette from red to white with 100 steps
rc1 <- colorRampPalette(colors = c("red", "white"), space = "Lab")(100)

## set positive palette from white to blue with 100 steps
rc2 <- colorRampPalette(colors = c("white", "blue"), space = "Lab")(100)

## Combine the two color palettes
rampcols <- c(rc1, rc2)

mypal <- colorNumeric(palette = rampcols, 
                      # domain = tst$xfr_rate_2
                      domain = -100:100
)
```


```{r}
map <- 
leaflet(
  options = leafletOptions(
    minZoom = 6.8,
    maxZoom = 11),
  height = 500
)|>
  
  setView(lng = -86.95, 
          lat = 39.8, 6) |>
  
  addProviderTiles(providers$CartoDB.Positron, ) |>
  
  addPolygons(data = cp,
              #fillColor = "#ededec",
              color = "#111111",
              fillColor = ~mypal(cp$xfr_rate_2),
              fillOpacity = 1,
              weight = .2,
              label = ~ lab2,
              group = "Net transfers",
  ) |> 
  
  # choropleth legend
    addLegendNumeric(
     # if using pipe to add this to leaflet map, leaving map causes issues; if map is assigned leaflet 'map' than no issue.
      mypal,
      values = cp$xfr_rate_2,
      title = 
        HTML("<span style='font-weight:600; line-height: normal'>Net transfers</span><br><span style='font-size: 9pt; font-weight:100; line-height: normal'><br>Per 100 students within legal settlement</span>"),
      shape = NULL,
      orientation = "horizontal",
      width = 215, # 200
      height = 15,
      bins = 7,
      tickLength = 2,
      decreasing = FALSE,
      fillOpacity = 1,
      group = "Net transfers",
      className = "info legend Nettransfers",
      labels = c("- 66",  "More than 100"),
      labelStyle = 'font-size: 10px',
      data = leaflet::getMapData(map),
      position = "topleft"
    )
    
```
